page.title: 04A WALK IN OUR D-BLOCK
page.content: We walked up Ruebury Lane and instead of turning up to Lady Chapel we stopped to look at the view.On the west was A.19,Ingleby Arncliffe was north,Osmotherley south and on the east was moorland.It was slightly misty so we couldn't see very well.We walked to Chapel Wood farm and along to the forest.On either side of us were conifer trees,many were dead. Sometimes you could see light but apart from that it was very dark. We had to be careful because it was muddy and slippery. Eventually we came out into the open again, high above the surrounding countryside. We looked right over the forest to the grassland and farms below. We could also see the Tontine and the reservoir. We then walked eastwards to join the road leading to the booster station but we turned south, back towards Osmotherley
